title: Turkey’s President Erdogan announces new cabinet
description: An internationally respected former banker gets top economy job, powerful intelligence chief is named foreign minister.

title: Could BRICS challenge US dominance in the global economy?
description: Group of emerging economies calls for rebalancing of the world order.

title: Biden signs debt ceiling bill, pulling US from brink of default
description: US president signs legislation lifting the debt ceiling, averting a catastrophic default on the government's debt.

title: Change is coming to Capitol Hill and Israel won’t like it
description: A recent event marking the Nakba at the US Congress shows Palestinians can no longer be silenced in Washington.

title: Barcelona win Women’s Champions League with stunning comeback
description: Down 2-0 at halftime, Barcelona came back to beat VfL Wolfsburg 3-2 at a sold out stadium in Eindhoven.

title: Residents brace for Sudan army’s recapture of Khartoum from RSF
description: Analysts suggest the Sudanese army pulled out of ceasefire talks to launch a major offensive to retake the capital.

title: Gundogan scores brace as Man City beat Man United to win FA Cup
description: City one game away from a historic treble after Ilkay Gundogan scored twice to beat United 2-1 in the FA Cup final.

title: ‘Second lease on life’ say survivors of deadly India train crash
description: Nearly 290 people have died in the accident involving three trains in the country's worst rail disaster in 20 years.

title: Italy detains two NGO vessels for defying new migrant rescue law
description: Rescue ships Sea-Eye 4 and Mare*Go have been blocked for 20 days for flaunting Italian legislation they call 'unjust'.

title: Three Israeli soldiers killed in shootings near Egyptian border
description: Israeli military said incidents took place during a security operation against smugglers in the Naqab (Negev) desert.

title: Sudan army brings in reinforcements as it battles RSF in Khartoum
description: Fighting has intensified in Khartoum as well as Darfur, despite US sanctions imposed in wake of truce collapse.

title: Why is the debt ceiling so contentious in the United States?
description: The US isn't the only country to set a debt ceiling, but it is the only nation to face brinkmanship over the issue.

title: UN, AU call for calm as death toll in Senegal violence rises
description: At least 10 people have been killed in Senegal following an outbreak of violence after sentencing of opposition leader.

title: Turkey’s Erdogan to take oath as president, to name new cabinet
description: The Turkish president is expected to unveil a new cabinet that will prioritise fixing the crisis-hit economy.

title: ‘We need peace’: M23 war displaces DRC residents yet again
description: For thousands of people in the eastern DRC, displacement in the latest M23 onslaught is another test of survival.

title: Succession: When fact and fantasy collide
description: What the blockbuster series Succession tells us about the media world we live in. Plus, Indian reporters under pressure.

title: Timeline: What are the world’s deadliest train crashes?
description: Train derailments are rare, yet collisions and accidents still occur despite efforts to improve safety.

title: Mexico’s deputy finance minister: Can inequality be reduced?
description: Gabriel Yorio González discusses Mexico’s struggle to deal with economic disparity.

title: UN agency for Palestinians raises just $107m of $300m needed
description: UNRWA provides services to nearly six million Palestinian refugees but is on verge of financial collapse, UN chief says.

title: In Pictures: India’s worst train disaster in 20 years
description: Rescuers race against time to pull out survivors, as toll from train collision in eastern India crosses 230.

title: Wagner boss says Russian forces laid mines to harm his fighters
description: Mercenary force boss Yevgeny Prigozhin says Russian defence officials planted explosives on route of Wagner's retreat.

title: US says talks with China key to a prevent ‘crisis or conflict’
description: US Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin tells security summit that 'conflict is neither imminent nor inevitable'.

title: CIA chief made secret trip to China amid tensions: US official
description: CIA Director William Burns emphasised the importance of keeping communication open between China and the US.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 465
description: As the war enters its 465th day, here’s a look at the main developments.

title: South America: A hard road to unity
description: Brazilian President Lula da Silva's push for more integration across the region will need to overcome major challenges.

title: Biden delivers first Oval Office address, touts debt-ceiling win
description: US President is set to sign into law a bipartisan agreement to lift the government's borrowing limit, averting 'crisis'.
